title: 112_hr3351
content: The Act titled "Franchise Education for Veterans Act" allows the use of educational assistance for franchise training. The GI Bill is amended to include various education programs for individuals not on active duty, such as apprenticeship, on-job training, cooperative programs, and training at approved establishments. Limitations on educational assistance are also added. The GI Bill is amended to include education programs for individuals not on active duty, with limitations on educational assistance for training programs at approved establishments. The GI Bill is amended to include education programs for individuals not on active duty, with limitations on educational assistance for training programs at approved establishments. The monthly stipend for training includes a basic allowance for housing and a stipend for books, supplies, equipment, and other educational costs. The number of months of entitlement charged is based on the total amount of educational assistance paid divided by the full-time monthly institutional rate of educational assistance. The GI Bill is amended to include education programs for individuals not on active duty, with limitations on educational assistance for training programs at approved establishments. The monthly stipend for training includes a basic allowance for housing and a stipend for books, supplies, equipment, and other educational costs. The total amount of educational assistance paid to an individual for a program is divided by the full-time monthly institutional rate of educational assistance. Payment of educational assistance under this subsection cannot exceed the individual's available entitlement. Adjustments may be made for individuals not described in specific subsections to reflect differences in educational assistance rates. A veteran may not receive more than 12 months of educational assistance under this subsection. The GI Bill is amended to include education programs for individuals not on active duty, with limitations on educational assistance. Veterans may not receive more than 12 months or $15,000 of educational assistance under this subsection. Amendments also cover training programs at approved establishments, with specific amounts allocated for training pursued in a 12-month period. The GI Bill is amended to include education programs for individuals not on active duty, with limitations on educational assistance. Training programs at approved establishments have specific amounts allocated for training pursued in a 12-month period, including fees and a monthly housing stipend. The GI Bill is amended to include education programs for individuals not on active duty, with limitations on educational assistance. For a member with dependents in pay grade E-5 residing in the military housing area, there is a monthly stipend for training pursued for educational costs or a lump sum of $15,000. The GI Bill now covers education programs for non-active duty individuals, with restrictions on assistance. A member in pay grade E-5 with dependents can receive a monthly stipend or a lump sum of $15,000 for educational costs. Veterans are limited to 12 months of assistance and a total of $15,000 in educational aid. The GI Bill now covers education programs for non-active duty individuals, with restrictions on assistance. A member in pay grade E-5 with dependents can receive a monthly stipend or a lump sum of $15,000 for educational costs. Veterans are limited to 12 months of assistance and a total of $15,000 in educational aid. Amendments have been made to payment procedures for training programs at specific establishments.
